description: A project to simplify reading config application/web config files in .Net
releaseNotes:
Version 1.0.5

- Added a TryExtractSettings<T> Method. This will return a configuration with the defaults set if an exception occurs.
- Removed the necessity to specify your strategy when calling ExtractSettings<T>. If you don't specify your strategy an underlying factory will choose the necessary factory for your based on your type.
- Removed the necessity to specify both the SectionGroup and SectionName if using groups. Now you can just specify the group and the system will use your class name as the section name if no other name is specified. (Backward compatibility safe).

Version 1.0.4

Made the current calls obsolete (Though still functional)
Replaced them with a method called ExtractSettings<T>(). This method take a strategy as an input.
Added Strategies for the following

-----------------------------------
- AppSettings
-----------------------------------
AppSettingExtractionStrategy

-----------------------------------
- Sections/SectionGroups
-----------------------------------
DictionarySectionHandlerExtractionStrategy
NameValueHandlerSectionExtractionStrategy
SingleTagSectionHandlerExtractionStrategy
CustomTypeSectionExtractionStrategy

To Call your config now you can use the following:
ExtractSettings<MyConfig>(new CustomTypeSectionExtractionStrategy())

The GitHub wiki will be updated for further information.

Version 1.0.3
Added support to read appSettings into a configuration class.

Version 1.0.2
Added support for configuration values to auto cast to property primitive types. i.e. Int, Decimal, etc etc.

Version 1.0.1
Added support for section groups
Added support for automatic section identification if no class attribute set.

Version 1.0.0
Currently only has support for populate config section objects.
title: ConfigurationAssist
